subject: Personal Finance
title: The COVID Market Crash
description: A fast breakdown of The COVID Market Crash for builders.

hook.text: In March 2020, the S&P 500 dropped 34% in 23 trading days. Then it recovered everything in five months.

buildup.text: COVID lockdowns shut down the global economy almost overnight. Markets panicked.

discovery.text: Governments responded with unprecedented stimulus â€” trillions in direct payments, loans, and Fed purchases.

twist.text: The fastest crash became the fastest recovery in history. But the stimulus contributed to persistent inflation.

climax.text: COVID proved that massive fiscal response can prevent depression but isn't free. Inflation is the deferred cost.

punchline.text: The bill for preventing collapse came as inflation.

quiz.question: What was a major side effect of COVID stimulus spending?
options: Persistent inflation in the years following
